final_answer.precision_note: Moles and volume are given to 3 s.f.; report Kc to 3 s.f. and as dimensionless.

method: For N2O4(g) ⇌ 2NO2(g), Kc = [NO2]^2/[N2O4]. Using concentrations [X] = n/V, substitute to eliminate concentration calculation: Kc = ( (n(NO2)/V)^2 ) / (n(N2O4)/V ) = n(NO2)^2 / (n(N2O4) × V). With n(NO2)=0.180 mol, n(N2O4)=0.220 mol, V=2.00 dm3: Kc = (0.180^2) / (0.220 × 2.00) = 0.0324 / 0.440 = 0.073636... = 0.0736 (3 s.f.).
checks: Kc is small (<1), indicating equilibrium favours N2O4, consistent with having comparable moles but NO2 needing to be squared.
